# Ⲏⲥⲉ-Ēse Ἶσις Isis 𐦥𐦣𐦯 Wosᶥˢ

𓊨 𓏏 𓆇 𓁐 ꜣst 'Steia 𓇼 ⇔ 𓍯 𓃾 𓆷 Stier (f!) ⇔ astra Astarte
Isis Ištar 𓋹 Oster Stern 𓊨𓏏𓅆 ( Venus Twins) ♀♀
Ištar stair 𓊨 𓏣 vs Astarte vs Aššur 𓇼

Alternative forms
𒅖𒋻 (iš-tar) 𒀭𒅖𒋻 d.iš-tar
𒌋𒐊 (15) 𒀭𒌋𒐊 (d15)

𒀭𒈹 (ᴰIštar) [DINGIR.INANNA] 𒎍 (logogram) Ishtar
→ Ancient Greek: Ᾰ̓στᾰ́ρτη (Astártē)
→ Latin: Astarte
→ Egyptian: ꜥsṯjrṯt (/astjirtjet/) Astiriṯt > Ástríðr Astrid Astrit !! <<

PSM ást (“love, joy”), Gothic 𐌰𐌽𐍃𐍄𐍃 (ansts Anstand, Anmut), or áss (“deity”). The second part is fríðr (“beautiful”). The Old Norse given name Ásta is a short form of Ástríðr and ancestor of Asta.

𒀭𒈹 Isis <?> 𒀭𒈹𒂞 Susanna (Goddess) @ 𒈹𒂞𒆠 Susa ⇔
𒀭𒈹𒂞 Susanna ⇔ ᵛInanna ♀ •Svianka 𓋴 𓋹 𓈖 𓐍 •Sbianka 𓋴 𓃀 𓇼 𓏤 star sΦαίνων

𓎬 #tjt tyet Isis-knot, knot of Isis or girdle of Isis

𓋴𓇋𓎛𓃶 saxa™ Ziege Geißler 𓎬 s𓎛hair

𓍯 𓃾 𓆷 Wosa 𐦥𐦣𐦯 Wos (Meroitic) Wusa Bosa Rosa •Verbosa

NL4 𓈣 fourth nome 󴝜 𓇔 Nit Resu "southern-net/shield", Isis @ south 𓇔 𓈣 󴝕 󴝖 󴝗 󴝘 󴝙 󴝚 󴝛 Goddess Isis
NL11 𓈫 eleventh 𓃒 𓐎 Ka-heseb, Goddess Isis
